title: Reflexive relation - Matrix representation
course: Discrete Mathematics by Prof Sudarshan Iyengar

transcript.text: What would be the corresponding  matrix representation?
Very easy to observe, I leave it to you  to think. I’ll just tell you the answer.
A matrix representation of a relation that is  reflexive will have all the diagonal entries 1,
as you can see, the diagonal entries  are all 1. Why? It’s obvious,
because of the definition of reflexive relation.
